content.user_title: Migrate WordPress sites and manage backups
content.value_statement: WordPress site migrations require complex coordination of database exports, file transfers, and URL replacements. This skill provides expert guidance for running wp-migrate.sh to safely migrate sites between servers, import backup archives, and roll back failed migrations.
actual_capabilities: Execute WordPress push migrations via SSH between servers
Import backup archives from Duplicator, Jetpack Backup, and Solid Backups
Perform database exports with URL search-replace
Create timestamped backups before destructive operations
Rollback failed migrations to restore previous state
Guide development workflows including build, test, and release processes
limitations: Requires SSH access for push mode and wp-cli installed on target servers
Does not support WordPress multisite networks
Rollback only works for archive mode migrations (not push mode)
Does not migrate site configurations or server-level settings

use_cases.title: Deploy sites to production
use_cases.description: Push staging changes to production servers with automated database sync and URL replacement

use_cases.title: Restore from backups
use_cases.description: Import backup archives from Duplicator, Jetpack, or Solid Backups to recover or clone sites

use_cases.title: Manage client migrations
use_cases.description: Standardize migration workflows with dry-run previews and rollback safety nets for all client sites

prompt_templates.title: Basic migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me run a WordPress push migration from staging to production. The source is at /var/www/staging and destination is user@prod.example.com:/var/www/html. Use dry-run mode first.

prompt_templates.title: Import backup
prompt_templates.prompt: Import a Duplicator backup archive at /backups/site-2024-10-20.zip to the current WordPress installation. Show me the preview before proceeding.

prompt_templates.title: Custom options
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a migration with custom SSH options (Port 2222, custom key), preserve destination plugins, and enable verbose logging to troubleshoot.

prompt_templates.title: Rollback
prompt_templates.prompt: The last migration failed. Help me use the rollback feature to restore the database and wp-content from the latest backup.

output_examples.input: Import a Duplicator backup archive to my WordPress site
output: I will help you import a Duplicator backup. First, let me check if you're in a WordPress directory and verify the archive file.
To proceed, I'll need to know:
2. Whether you want a dry-run preview first (recommended)
Would you like to see a dry-run preview of the import? This will show you what will happen without making any changes.

best_practices: Always use --dry-run --verbose first to preview migration operations before executing
Create local backups before migrations and verify restoration with --rollback in test environments
Enable verbose logging (--verbose or --trace) when troubleshooting migration issues
anti_patterns: Running migrations without dry-run preview on production sites
Skipping the backup step or not verifying backup integrity before migrations
Ignoring disk space requirements (script requires 3x archive size for archive mode)

faq.question: What servers and tools are required?
faq.answer: Requires wp-cli installed on source/destination servers. SSH access needed for push mode. Supports Duplicator, Jetpack Backup, and Solid Backups archives.

faq.question: What is the maximum site size supported?
faq.answer: Limited by available disk space (3x archive size required). Database imports may need increased max_allowed_packet in MySQL configuration.

faq.question: Can I use this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Use --yes flag to skip confirmation prompts and --quiet to suppress progress indicators for automated workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe during migration?
faq.answer: Script creates timestamped backups before any destructive operations. Includes dry-run mode for preview and --rollback command for recovery.

faq.question: Why is my migration failing?
faq.answer: Common causes: SSH connectivity issues, missing wp-cli, disk space problems, or table prefix mismatches. Use --verbose --trace for debugging.

faq.question: How is this different from other migration tools?
faq.answer: Uses native wp-cli and rsync for efficient transfers. Supports multiple archive formats. Includes rollback safety and dry-run previews.
